sources.data_found: Satori Cluster: 64 Power9 nodes; 4 NVIDIA V100 GPUs per node; 256 V100 GPUs total.
OpenMind: ~340 GPUs total, including 142 A100-80GB GPUs. Satori is ORCD-supported.
ORCD total >1400 GPUs. Engaging has 366 online. 32 H100s current, 96 being added.
PSFC cluster: 3 nodes x 4 V100s, 3 nodes x 4 RTX6000.
TX-GAIA: 896 NVIDIA Tensor Core V100 GPUs.
Computing majors are the largest at MIT.
Engaging public partitions: L40S (259 total), H100 (48 total), H200 (96 total), A100 (68 total).
SuperCloud (MGHPCC TX-E1): 224 GPU nodes; 448 V100 GPUs.

student_data.notes: Updated with 2024-2025 Registrar Data: 363 Master of Engineering (MEng) + 850 Doctoral in EECS. Undergrad estimated at 1300 (EECS majors).

gpu_resources.notes: Excluded Lincoln Lab AI Factory (restricted access). Counts reflect accessible campus clusters (Satori, Supercloud, OpenMind, Engaging). V100 count adjusted to 1,152 (256 Satori + 896 Supercloud/TX-GAIA).

analysis_notes: Ensemble result aggregated from OpenAI, Claude, and Gemini models. Significant discrepancy in student numbers due to varying definitions of 'CS Student' (broad EECS vs specific CS track). GPU data is robust, combining campus research computing (ORCD) with the massive Lincoln Laboratory Supercomputing Center resources.
validation_notes: GPU CHANGES: Removed 896 V100 GPUs associated with the MGHPCC Supercloud (TX-E1) as it is a shared resource. Only counted the 256 V100 GPUs from the Satori cluster, which is directly owned by MIT. Student data was verified and remains unchanged.
